definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: If there is any discrepancy, the English version is the official version.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何差异，请以官方的英文版本作准。

sentences.english: All dimensions may be inaccurate and are subject to adjustments.
sentences.chinese: 所有标示的尺寸，或会有所调整，不可作准。

sentences.english: Registration is on first-come-first serve basis.
sentences.chinese: 研讨会登记以先到先得方式作准。

sentences.english: As space is limited, the Press Room will serve on a first-come-first-serve basis.
sentences.chinese: 由于位置有限，此服务以先到先得方式作准。
研讨会的座位登记是以先到先得方式作准。

sentences.english: Registration base on first come first serve basis.
Prevail Chinese version of this website.
sentences.chinese: 本网页内容以中文版本作准。

sentences.english: This offer is subject to the Club's terms and conditions.
sentences.chinese: 以上优惠以本会条款及细则作准。

sentences.english: How could we believe her, since she never means what she says?
sentences.chinese: 一个说话不作准的人，我们怎么能相信她。

definition: to jump to an unfounded conclusion
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
lit. on hearing wind, to say rain/to agree uncritically with whatever people say/to parrot other people's words/to chime in with others
pinyin: ting1 jian4 feng1 jiu4 shi4 yu3

definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
